sentence.text: Mutations in ganglioside-induced differentiation-associated-protein 1 (mitochondrial fission) have been associated with both subtypes of Charcot-Marie-Tooth (CMT) disease, autosomal recessive (CMT4A and AR-CMT2K) and autosomal dominant (AD-CMT2K).

Our study expands the mutational spectrum of mitochondrial fission-related CMT disease with the identification of new and unreported GDAP1 variants and demonstrates the predominance of the axonal form of neuropathy in CMT disease associated with GDAP1.
